docs.title: What Is MiniPaper?
docs.text: MiniPaper is a collection of utility-plugins, but also a philosophy: Why make things complicated if they can just be simple?

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
MiniPaper is fully open-source, you can find all source code here.

If you want to add something to a MiniPaper project, just send patches or open issues! If you want to create new projects, message us on Discord by following the Link on this site.

docs.title: MiniTab
docs.text: MiniTab is a very simplistic TabList header/footer manager. It supports MiniMessage and PlaceholderAPI.

docs.title: MiniMessage
docs.text: MiniTab supports MiniMessage for rich styling in the TabList. Have a look at the MiniMessage Docs

docs.title: PlaceholderAPI
docs.text: MiniTab users can use PlaceholderAPI placeholders in both header and footer. Refer to the PlaceholderAPI documentation to discover Placeholders.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
MiniTab has a small set of commands that can be used to manage it.

Command Description Permission /tab info Shows Information about the Plugin none /tab reload Reloads the Config mini.tab.manage /tab stop Suspends MiniTab (removes the TabList mini.tab.manage /tab start Resumes MiniTab mini.tab.manage

docs.title: Gradients
docs.text: MiniTab has support for nice colorful animations in both header and footer, by using MiniMessage's phase feature. The phase is essentially automatically incremented every tick and the gradient is then re-rendered.

docs.title: Create A Gradient In The TabList
docs.text:
[...]
{
  "raw": "<gradient:red:blue:<x>>Welcome to my server</gradient>"
  [...]
}

The first tag, <gradient:color:color:phase> creates a new gradient between the two colors. The third argument, the phase, has to be set to <x>. MiniTab will then replace this with the appropriate phase to create a smooth animation.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• At least Java 23
  • A Paper Server
Spigot Fork Compatibility

Tab only works with Paper and derivatives, Spigot and Bukkit won't work! Spigot and Bukkit are "legacy" versions, that should not be used if not absolutely necessary!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: • Just drop the jar into your plugin folder and restart the Server.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
MiniTab is configured through the plugins/Mini/Tab/config.json file.

Note

When editing the config while running the server, make sure to always run /mini:tab reload after saving to apply the changes

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
{
  "version": 1,
  "header": {
    "raw": "<gradient:red:blue:<x>>Hello, %player_name%!</gradient>",
    "animated": true,
    "animationSpeed": 0.1
  },
  "footer": {
    "raw": "<blue><b>Its an nice Day!</b></blue>",
    "animated": false,
    "animationSpeed": 0.0
  }
}

header -> Shown above the players footer -> Shown below the players raw -> MiniMessage String to display. Can use PlaceholderAPI animated -> If set to true, gradients will animate in the part of the Tablist animationSpeed -> the higher, the faster the animation

Animation prerequisites

Animations are created by (ab)using the phase feature of MiniMessage. If you want to use them, have a look at the gradient guide
